classSpec.desc: groups structural elements which may be fragmented, usually as a consequence of some overlapping hierarchy.

attDef.desc: specifies whether or not its parent element is fragmented in some way, typically by some other overlapping structure : for example a speech which is divided between two or more verse stanzas, a paragraph which is split across a page division, a verse line which is divided between two speakers.

valItem.desc: the element is fragmented in some (unspecified) respect
either the element is not fragmented, or no claim is made as to its completeness.
this is the initial part of a fragmented element
this is a medial part of a fragmented element
this is the final part of a fragmented element

remarks.p: The values I, M, or F should be used only where it is clear how the element may be be reconstituted.
